roleset.name: give
roleset.note: PRESENT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'present' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet class fulfilling-13.4.1, reflexive_appearance-48.1.2; other framed members include charge and invest. Comparison to 'give'. (from present.01-v)
PRESENTING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from presenting.01-n)

example.name: present-v: just transitive
example.text: But such a combination also presents great risks.

example.name: present-v: with attribute
example.text: But I think we are losing credibility because when the market does this, it doesn't present itself as a rational investment.

example.name: present-v: with recipient
example.text: John presented Mary with a bouquet of wilted dandelions.
example.arg: with a bouquet of wilted dandelions

example.name: presentation-n: Args 0, 1, 2
example.text: Jakob's presentation of the gift to the foundation was surprisingly generous.

roleset.name: to emerge during birth
roleset.note: PRESENT-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in medical question corpus. Framed by Claire, Will, Jena, Anwen& Martha. No relevant VN entry. (from present.101-v)

role.descr: orientation of infant: breech, vertex, transversely, etc

example.name: present-v: Infant as subject
example.text: It is normal for the fetus to present breech in the second trimester and spontaneously invert sometime in the third trimester.

example.name: present-v: Body part as subject
example.text: A variation is when-1 one or both feet present first *T*-1, called a "footling breech".

example.name: present-v: all arguments
example.text: Baby John presented transversely, right shoulder first.

example.name: presentation-n: Arg1, 3
example.text: The baby's breech presentation required intervention from the obstetrician.

roleset.name: to appear in a clinical setting
roleset.note: PRESENT-V NOTES: Roleset based on medical questions, framed by Will Styler, no VN (from present.102-v)

roles.note: This sense can occur both with a patient/Arg0 as subject ("The patient presented with severe bleeding") or with a disorder/Arg1 as subject ("Rectal cancer can initially present as rectal bleeding") (from present.102-v)

example.name: present-v: Disorder as Arg0
example.text: Can diabetic neuropathy present as flank radicular pain ?

example.name: present-v: Patient as Arg0
example.text: Elderly patient presented in clinic this morning with lower back pain

example.name: presentation-n: Arg0, 2
example.text: The patient's presentation with severe chest pains caused the doctors to immediately administer and ECG test.

example.name: presentation-n: Arg1, 2
example.text: Diabetic neuropathy's inital presentation as flank radicular pain can throw off less experienced diagnosticians.

roleset.name: in attendance
roleset.note: PRESENT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1. (from present.01-j)

example.name: present-j: both args
example.text: I am not for a law that prevents people from keeping a gun in their home although I am for safety regulations especially where-1 children are present *T*-1.

example.name: present-j: with TMP
example.text: Mother of newborn trapped in sewer was present for rescue
example.arg: Mother of newborn trapped in sewer

example.name: presence-n
example.text: John's presence at the table created an uproar

roleset.name: suitable for presentation
roleset.note: PRESENTABLE-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. Relation to 'present.01' (from presentable.01-j)

example.name: presentable-j: arg1
example.text: Done ! There 're others you can check out at dinner to make sure they 're presentable enough for fb :-RRB- do you know what time people want to get food ?
